main.name: Teemu Sormunen
main.description: Exploring the latest machine learning trends.
main.bio: I'm a second year Master's degree student at Aalto University. I enjoy challenging myself with thought experiments, as well as with real life coding challenges. I enjoy spending my free time reading about latest advancements in machine learning and neuroscience. If I'm not busy working on my side-projects, you can find me enjoying the outdoors or playing the guitar.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

education.degree: Masters programme in Machine Learning, Data Science and Artificial Intelligence
education.description: Bayesian data analysis, deep learning, kernel methods, natural language processing

education.degree: Bachelor of engineering in automation engineering - intelligent machines and devices
education.description: Electrical and automation engineering basic studies. Additional courses and skills in computer vision, autonomous robotics and machine learning.

work.title: Data Science Trainee
work.description: Worked on a project where wide area of machine learning approaches were explored, such as deep learning and association learning. Also got familiarity in MLOPS in the form of building machine learning solution pipelines from scratch. Programming language: Python.

work.title: Mobile Developer Trainee
work.description: Mobile development for native Android and iOS. Worked with Kotlin and Swift. Also got familiarity in using Git, CI/CD pipelines and Linux.

awards.body: Loop Q Prize 2021 is a machine learning competition for European university. It's goal is to get students to discover the field of cognitive computing.

awards.text: That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
